23-Apr-2024             Electromyography             Final Report
Study Number: 1


EMG Consultant: Staff, Nathan P. 127 or (77)4-6421
Referred by: MAUERMANN, MICHELLE L (127 or (77)4-6689)
Referred for: Left arm pain/weakness
Referral Code:      240  310
RX: 240  310


SUMMARY: Prior to starting the procedure, the patient's identity was verified, pertinent available records were reviewed, the nature of the procedure was explained, the appropriate sites of the exam were confirmed directly with the patient, and a 
pre-procedure pause was performed for final verification of all of the above.  


At nerve conduction studies demonstrated low amplitude median and ulnar compound muscle action potentials.  The left ulnar sensory nerve action potential was low amplitude.  Bilateral medial antebrachial cutaneous sensory responses were absent the left 
lateral antebrachial cutaneous response was nearly half the size of that on the right.  Needle electromyography demonstrated reduced recruitment of long duration motor unit potentials most severe in upper trunk and lower trunk innervated muscles.  With 
fibrillation potentials throughout.  The triceps was relatively spared.  Cervical paraspinals did not exhibit fibrillation potentials although neurogenic motor unit potentials were seen.


CLINICAL INTERPRETATION: This is a complex EMG.  There is electrodiagnostic evidence of a chronic active neurogenic process involving the left upper extremity.  Neurologic localization for hand weakness appears most prominent in the lower trunk of the 
brachial plexus, where as the proximal weakness appears more localized to a mix of the root and upper trunk regions.


N. Staff (127 or (77)4-6421)/SMB
